sentences.english: He fell from the bridge and dashed his brains out on the rocks below.
sentences.chinese: 他从大桥掉下来，在下面的岩石上撞得脑浆迸裂而死。

sentences.english: Get up, or I'll strew your brains upon the grass.
sentences.chinese: 起来，否则我就把你的脑浆洒在这草地上。

sentences.english: When lives are on the line…and you're poking at brains like they're silly putty.
sentences.chinese: 命悬一线的同时，你正在戳着那些黏糊糊的脑浆。

sentences.english: Just big boy one gun beat its brains sonses to all fly, does the Zha still know to rush toward a person?
sentences.chinese: 刚才大小子一枪把它脑浆子都打飞了，咋还懂得扑人？

sentences.english: Before his axe released from it purplish blood clots and ginger-juice-colored brains.
sentences.chinese: 他的利斧从里面放出深紫的淤血和姜汁状的脑浆。

sentences.english: served on plates got the same reaction.
sentences.chinese: 脑浆被挖出并放在盘子里的电影后，也有同样的反应。

sentences.english: Then the eyes squirted from their sockets and finally, brain matter squirted from the ears.
sentences.chinese: 接着眼睛从眼窝被挤出来，脑浆从耳朵溢出来。

sentences.english: The earth upstream drips one stand haematoporphyrin and there is also spots brains.
sentences.chinese: 地上流淌着一摊血，还有少许脑浆。

sentences.english: The young man's skull had been split open, and blood and brains were gushing out.
sentences.chinese: 那个青年的头骨破裂了，血和脑浆不断涌出。

sentences.english: Put a gun to my head and paint the wall with my brains.
sentences.chinese: 把枪对着我的脑袋，用我的脑浆在墙上作画吧。

definition: to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
(of droplets, sparks etc) to fly about in all directions/to splatter everywhere
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
the seven apertures of the human head: 2 eyes, 2 ears, 2 nostrils, 1 mouth
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
